    • check

      @RequestMapping(value={"check","check.html"}, method=POST) public String check(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response, org.springframework.ui.Model mvcModel, Writer writer, @RequestParam(required=false) String url, @RequestParam(required=false) String retDesired, @RequestParam(required=false) Boolean autofix, @RequestParam(required=false) org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Behavior filter, @RequestParam(required=false) Integer maxErrors, @RequestParam(required=false) String profile, @ModelAttribute("normalizer") org.biopax.paxtools.normalizer.Normalizer normalizer) throws IOException
      JSP pages and RESTful web services controller, the main one that checks BioPAX data. All parameter names are important, i.e., these are part of public API (for clients) System parameters:
      Parameters:
      request - the web request object (may contain multi-part data, i.e., multiple files uploaded)
      response -
      mvcModel - Spring MVC Model
      writer - HTTP response writer Validator parameters:
      url -
      retDesired -
      autofix -
      filter -
      maxErrors -
      profile - Normalizer parameters:
      normalizer - binds to view options: normalizer.fixDisplayName, normalizer.inferPropertyOrganism, normalizer.inferPropertyDataSource
      Returns:
      results view name (or null if XML or normalized RDF/XML were requested)
      Throws:
      IOException - when data cannot be read from the files or URL, etc.
